job description:
Bioinformatics Scientist - NIH – Bethesda, MD

Kelly Government Solutions is a strategic supplier and business partner to the federal government and its key suppliers. Through our partnership with the National Institutes of Health, Kelly Government Solutions offers administrative, IT, engineering, scientific, and healthcare professionals the opportunity to work with one of the most prestigious research organizations in the world. We are currently seeking a Bioinformatics Scientists to work onsite with the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, MD.

This is a long-term contract position which offers:
  • Competitive salary with comprehensive benefit package
  • Tremendous growth opportunity
  • Opportunity to work at NIH, the world's foremost medical research center
  • Learn more about what Kelly can do for you at www.kellygovernmentsolutions.com

    TASKS. The contractor shall:
  • Analyze large data sets generated from a wide range of techniques including next-generation sequencing, microarray analysis, mass spectrometry, and high-throughput screening.
  • Use existing infrastructure and optimize pipelines for next-generation sequencing projects.
  • Work with data from RNA-seq, ChIP-seq and related high-throughput sequencing experiments; perform tasks, including but not limited to, quality control, alignment of reads and downstream analysis such as differential expression and peak-calling.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of new technologies, assays and methods; learn and incorporate these into subsequent analyses.
  • Develop new algorithms for analysis of next-generation sequencing and other genomics data.
  • Collaborate with staff on the design of experiments for next generation sequencing projects.
  • Utilize NIH’s high-performance computing resources to process data.
  • Develop tools using Python and/or R programming languages for commonly-performed tasks and for integrating results from multiple experiments.
  • Maintain and update code and commands used for analyses to ensure reproducible results.
  • Collect and review data; analyze and interpret data and results; provide reports based on analysis of scientific data.
  • Work with staff on data visualization to support the preparation of presentations and manuscripts for submission to scientific journals.
  • Co-write manuscripts.
  • Attend meetings; present research outcomes and make recommendations for future work.
  • Teach and advise staff in the use of bioinformatics analysis tools.
REQUIREMENTS. The contractor must have:
  • Ph.D. in Bioinformatics or a related discipline; three (3) years of specialized experience plus a Master’s degree is equivalent to a Ph.D.
  • Minimum of three (3) years of related experience.
  • Expertise in high-throughput sequencing analysis of DNA or RNA sequence data using command-line tools, integrating the results from multiple experiments and applying biological knowledge of the interpretation of the results.
  • Knowledge of software development techniques, such as unit testing and version control.
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of R and/or Python programming languages.
  • Strong communications skills, both oral and written.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills.
PLEASE APPLY ONLINE.

Note that the phone number for our NIH branch is not listed. Due to the high volume of inquiries, we regret that we cannot accept phone calls. All qualified candidates will be contacted.
